citation.article-title: Loktanella salsilacus gen. nov., sp. nov., Loktanella fryxellensis sp. nov. and Loktanella vestfoldensis sp. nov., new members of the Rhodobacter group, isolated from microbial mats in Antarctic lakes.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Loktanella (Lok.tan.el′la. N.L. fem. n. Loktanella named after Tjhing-Lok Tan from the Alfred Wegener Institute in Bremerhaven, who contributed to our understanding of marine and polar bacteriology and ecology).
Gram-negative, rod-shaped cells that are strictly aerobic, moderately halotolerant and chemoheterotrophic.
They do not form spores and the optimal growth temperature is 25 °C.

The dominant fatty acid is 18 : 1 ω7c and other characteristic fatty acids are 10 : 0 3OH, 16 : 0, 18 : 0 and summed feature 7 (which comprises the unknown fatty acid 18.846, 19 : 1 ω6c and 19 : 0 cyclo ω10c).
The DNA G+C content ranges from 59·4 to 66·4 mol%.
As determined by 16S rRNA gene sequence analysis, the genus Loktanella belongs to the Rhodobacter group within the α-Proteobacteria.
The type species is Loktanella salsilacus.
